alert.note: Alert for Knox; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox, southwestern Leslie and southeastern Clay Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plank, or 7 miles southeast of Manchester, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ogle around 310 PM EDT. Lipps around 315 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Creekville, Brightshade, Ice Cliff, Ashers Fork, Spring Creek, Skidmore, Queendale, Roark, Gardner, Salt Gum, Erose and Hammond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
